title.narrative: 4.2 INFANT AND YOUNG CHILD FEEDING

description.narrative: Output 4.2: By 2018, pregnant and lactating women and all caretakers of children, including fathers, have knowledge of and apply infant and young child feeding practices and other essential care practices, which contributes to Infant And Young Child Feeding, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 4: Children under 5, pregnant and lactating women, particularly among the most vulnerable, have access to and make greater use of quality promotional, preventive and curative services for the prevention of chronic malnutrition, management of acute malnutrition and reduction of micronutrient deficiencies.

ONG CISP COMITATO INTERNAZIONALE PER LO SVILUPPO DEI POPOLI

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.2: By 2018, pregnant and lactating women and all caretakers of children, including fathers, have knowledge of and applyinfant and young child feeding practices and other essential care practices

description.narrative: Over 8,050 (43%) villages nationally acquired capacity to provide IYCF promotional and counselling services. The rollout of community IMCI services which integrated IYCF from the outset promises greater sustainability of IYCF results. The adopted IYCF strategy and operational plan are a further step forward to guide implementation at all levels. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/01/2019
